fields.description:
Currently, if you have a empty string value for a plan variable in the Run customised process the plan value is not updated. Steps to replicate the problem:

# Create a plan variable with value foo
# Run a job with the plan variable
# After the job build process ended visit the job again click on "Run customised"
# Now replace the plan value with empty string

The value variable will be substitute with "foo: instead of empty string
fields.summary: Empty string variable will not be subtitude during Run customised option process

fields.description:
Enhancement BAM-9113 was implemented in the 3.3 release however it fails to meet all expectations.

Original use case was to mask only variables entered at time of build.

We require that specific variables can be masked based off of a selection or alternatively the ability to not include build parameters in build logs.

We supply passwords to Ant tasks through the Ant Target line however these are visible in the log, which is not desired. Alternatively we can configure a build to have the passwords statically set through the Build Variables section however these are visible when a user builds a customized job and we cannot limit the visibility of this through permissions, or limit a user's ability to build a customized job vs non.

The Mask Passwords plugin for Hudson is ideal for us but we are trying to move off of Hudson to Bamboo.
fields.summary: Hide passwords in all build variables

fields.description:
Currently, Bamboo does not trigger build when user switches branches.
It's OK to treat the branch change as an initial build (without changes), but still, the build should be triggered.
fields.summary: Mercurial: Bamboo does not trigger build  when user switches branches

fields.description: It seems that PS needs some special handling. We should investigate it and have PS supported, as it is a standard Windows shell.
fields.summary: Bamboo ScriptTask should support PowerShell

fields.description:
When sending out [notifications for a plan/job|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+Notifications+for+a+Plan+and+its+Jobs], there is no way for the email format to be set for a recipient configured under "Email Address".
As a result the notifications are sent out in default txt format. 

This should be made a configurable option similar to a "User" recipient which allows you to set user profile to either txt/html for email notifications.
fields.summary: Have a global configuration to set email format for non-bamboo users

fields.description:
We have circa 500 plans in bamboo.  If you work across projects as I do, it gets hard to find a plan.  Can you add the ability to search for a plan using free text or the plan key.

1. A search box from anywhere on the site.  Search ahead functionality so that is begins to show results and allows the user to click navigate when the see what they want.

2. An advanced search where you can enter more criteria and see a list of plan links after pressing search.  Less interactive but rich searching.

Ps....Hudson / Jenkins has number 1...and its 90% of what most users need.  So you could get away with just implementing number 1.
fields.summary: Add search plan capabilities

fields.description:
The bamboo All Plans page is becoming unusable for us. Its very slow and some browsers are struggle to cope with the volume of javascript working on the page. In fact IE, Firefox, Chrome, Chromium all struggle at some point, although Chromium does best.

We have circa 500+ plans with around 30 groups...possibly more.

Do you have plans to make it possible to configure this page?

On my wishlist would be the following suggestions.

1. To be able to carve up the page and expand a hierarchy of plans. Only the expanded groups should run ajax calls.

2. The default landing page should be as fast as you can possibly make it.
fields.summary: Please improve all plans performance

fields.description: Deleted repositories will reappear after import. Some of them will randomly become default repositories. They won't be sued for change collection anymore, but will be used for build tirggering if they were marked as triggers.
fields.summary: Deletion marker is not exported/imported for repositories
Make the help-path.properties update the redirection URL automatically

fields.description:
See screenshots. The first project has a single plan, which you can expand and collapse. However, when it is collapsed it doesn't take up any less space -- it just shows less information.

I think it would be better to get rid of the expando for single-plan projects and just show the information immediately.
fields.summary: Single plan projects have unnecessary expand control ("twixie") on dashboard

We should document the "Only run Build if other Plans are currently passing" feature.
fields.summary: Document conditional build feature

fields.description: We should investigate the reason behind - maybe it can't be fixed, but maybe it indicates some db structure problem.
fields.summary: Deletion of plan results takes very long to complete

fields.description:
I would like to be able to retrieve information about specific test case in the context of a Plan or Job using REST.
See BAM-9934
fields.summary: Enhanced REST endpoint for testcases

fields.description:
When looking at test case summary, I would like to get a table with last N builds (N=20 or configurable) with explicit information whether given test case passed, failed or was absent in given build.

As a bonus I would love to get a mouseover with detailed build info - changesets, failed test count etc - but I can implement that with SpeakEasy myself later if you can't ;-)

I need this info to diagnose:
- whether this test seems to fail randomly
- whether this test disappears in some builds and reappears later.

Due to BAM-9933 I would love to have this info on plan level as well as job level - so if this test executes in JOB1 in some builds and JOB2 in others, I would like to see all executions in one place.
fields.summary: More explicit information about test case

fields.description:
I have a plan with 16k tests spread across multiple jobs.
The test has ugly feature of jumping across the jobs on different plan executions (JBAC optimizations)

I need to track specific test execution across builds, but unless it's failing there is no easy way to find it.

I would like to:
- have plan-level "Tests" tab similar to Job-level one, with an aggregation of test results of jobs, so I can see all tests regardless of the actual job
- be able to narrow the displayed tests by textual match (so I can see all tests matching "plugin.mail.someT")
fields.summary: Track specific test cases via textual match across builds regardless of job that executed it
plan_vcs_history with -1 for repositoryId after upgrade

fields.description:
While monitoring a Bamboo Agent server running on my laptop with a network monitoring tool, I am able to observe that remote agent servers ping the primary Bamboo server approximately once every 1 or 2 seconds with a lengthy status message so the primary Bamboo server knows the agent is responding and available to build projects. The "heartbeat ping" is approximately 1400 bytes (1.4 K) and is in the format as follows :

<com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.messages.UpdateHeartbeatMessage>
<agentId>2981919</agentId>
<status class="com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.AgentIdleStatus"/>
<systemInfo>
<userName>Adam</userName>
<userTimezone>America/New_York</userTimezone>
<userLocale>English (United States)</userLocale>
<systemEncoding>Cp1252</systemEncoding>
<operatingSystem>Windows XP 5.1</operatingSystem>
<operatingSystemArchitecture>x86</operatingSystemArchitecture>
<systemDate>Wednesday, 21 Sep 2011</systemDate>
<systemTime>13:56:59</systemTime>
<tempDir>D:\DOCUME~2\Adam\LOCALS~1\Temp\</tempDir>
<userHome>D:\Documents and Settings\Adam</userHome>
<totalMemory>248</totalMemory>
<freeMemory>175</freeMemory>
<usedMemory>72</usedMemory>
<availableProcessors>2</availableProcessors>
<startupTimestamp>1316627008604</startupTimestamp>
<currentDirectory>D:\Documents and Settings\Adam\bamboo-agent-home\bin</currentDirectory>
<applicationHome>D:\Documents and Settings\Adam\bamboo-agent-home</applicationHome>
<buildWorkingDirectory>D:\Documents and Settings\Adam\bamboo-agent-home\xml-data\build-dir</buildWorkingDirectory>
<freeDiskSpace>3 GB</freeDiskSpace>
<currentDate>2011-09-21 13:56:59.394 EDT</currentDate>
<hostName>REDACTED</hostName>
<ipAddress>REDACTED</ipAddress>
</systemInfo>
</com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.messages.UpdateHeartbeatMessage>

This seems to be a lot of info to send the main Bamboo server EVERY SECOND. Are all these fields needed? Can a more minimal heartbeat be sent every second (or every 5 seconds). Is there any way to configure or throttle this heartbeat down to reduce network bandwidth. Perhaps strip the heartbeat down to 3-5 minimal fields sent every 1-2 seconds, and then resend the entire message each 30-60 seconds?
fields.summary: Reduce Bamboo Remote Agent Heartbeat Size and Number of Fields

fields.description:
When specifying a platform to build in the Visual Studio builder tasks' configuration page the parameter is not passed to further steps correctly.

The parsing of arguments in bamboo is good, but devenv is a 'special' beast:
1. It has parameters pairs separated by whitespace
2. The platform to build uses the pipe symbol (what were they thinking?)

An example: devenv Project.sln /Rebuild "Release|Any CPU"

To get around the first issue we changed the options to: /Rebuild '"Release|Any CPU"'
To get around the second issue we needed to modify devenvrunner.bat to add quotes to the argument if it contained a pipe character.

I have attached our fix for the batch file.
fields.summary: Visual Studio builder task does not allow the pipe symbol to be passed in the arguments

fields.description:
[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/13950/mercurial-repository-url-build-variables]:
{quote}
Hi,

We're using Bamboo 3.2 and are trying to build a specific Mercurial tag or changeset for our release builds. The Repository URL on the source repository configuration screen supports the #revision syntax, which is great. What I would like to do is parametize this using the bamboo build variables.

Something like the following:

{noformat}http://path/to/repository#${bamboo.tagToBuild}{noformat}

However I get a malformed url error message when I attempt to do this. To me, this seems the simplest way to achieve builds based on a particular tag, but I'd like to know if we're trying to do this the wrong way.

Can anyone please advise how they have overcome with this particular problem? Or is this something unique to us, and possibly indicating that we should be following a different process?

Cheers,

Adam
{quote}

the root of the problem is probably here - no cache directory variable substitution:
[https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/bamboo/src/b1b1573dbd0c/components/bamboo-plugins/bamboo-plugin-mercurial/src/main/java/com/atlassian/bamboo/plugins/hg/HgRepository.java#cl-194]

fields.description:
Currently, if a build plan is marked as "requires a clean build", the whole build directory, including the .git folder, is removed.
This makes it necessary to perform a repository clone again. In our case, this wastes approximately 10 minutes of time for each job in each build on larger repos. With 15 jobs in a build plan, this adds up to a lot of wasted resources.

We think that a cleaning procedure that would leave the .git folder but remove everything else would probably provide much better performance (only a fetch of the latest changes necessary) while still retaining the safety of a clean build.

Switching to non-cleaned builds may be an option in some cases, but we find it very difficult to ensure that builds do not influence each other without the clean step. As we see Bamboo as "the source of truth", we'd rather not sacrifice this safety for performance.
fields.summary: In addition to the existing "clean" and "non-clean" build options, allow a clean build without a new clone of a git repository

fields.description:

There are 2 problem areas:
- adding variable to URL doesn't necessarily mean repository is different
- changing value of variable doesn't trigger all 'isRepositoryDifferent' handling

fields.description:
For example at the moment you can specify that you want a capability to:

- exist
- equal something (string)
- equal something (regex)

But there does not seem to be a way to say that you want a capability to not exist

e.g. if you wanted to tag an agent so that only one build would use it and that other builds would avoid that agent, then it would be useful if you could put one capability on the agent and have the other builds check that the capability does not exist

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) grab {color:red}jira 4.2{color} (we can't reproduce problem on jira 4.3+)
2) grab bamboo 3.2.2
3) set up an application link from bamboo to jira, use outgoing "basic access"
4) set up a test project with a test issue on jira instance
5) set up a test project with a test plan on bamboo instance
5.1) force that plan to detect changes on a repository that will contain commit with jira-issue comment
5.2) for example:
{noformat}
mkdir test ; cd test
hg init ; echo "aaa" >> aaa.txt ; hg add aaa.txt ; hg commit --user "user" -m "initial"
echo "aaa" >> aaa.txt ; hg commit --user "user" -m "BAM-9867 message message"
# repeat above line when you need to trigger bamboo build
{noformat}
6) go to build result page of the plan, build should have contain commits with "BAM-9867" comments. (replace "BAM-9867" with your jira instance test issue)
7.1) when you click on "BAM-9867" you will get "unexpected error has occured"
7.2) while you should be redirected to the jira page
8.1) on the JIRA issues panel you should have see your issue, with it's icon, and with link to your jira instance
8.2) instead you will see something like "Can't retrieve issues" or similar error, I don't remember.
9) obviosly "Issues" tab is borked as well.
fields.summary: Bamboo should use default application link to retrieve issues +from jira 4.2.x+ when no project entity link is set up for a plan.

fields.description:
Or at least give some information to the customer that he need to upgrade his plans/projects configuration manually if he want to see issues on build result pages.

See [BSP-5504|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-5504] for details.

Another resolution would be to update "Upgrade Guides" on CAC. (I don't know where they are, if somebody would link them here and remove my comment - kudos).
fields.summary: Upgrade from pre 3.2 should set up project links properly.

fields.description: I think we need to make documentation better in the area of Bamboo->Jira integration. We added in Bamboo 3.2 a feature "project link", which is very invisible in the Bamboo, and I think it is a reason of confusion for some of the customers ([BSP-5504|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-5504], [BSP-5492|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-5492]). This should be clear that to use "view issues in build result page" feature a user have to set up a project link for that particular plan(project) explicitly, in the project 'configuration' page (dashboard->all plans->project (not plan, not build)->application links.
fields.summary: Update Bamboo->JIRA integration documentation (project applink in 3.2.x)

fields.description:
This could be filed as an improvement since I think plan level variables in the audit log may have been out of scope for the audit log feature.

This functionality would be extremely helpful for tracking down plan level variables since our team is using them extensively for releasing JIRA.
fields.summary: Changes in plan variables do not show up in the audit log

fields.description: It links build only to the latest user commit. There's a bug in getResultSummariesByChangeSetId method query that returns result summaries only if the changeset is the latest changeset.
fields.summary: My Bamboo looks weird when more than one commit is involved in a build :-)

fields.description:
When I setup a plan, for example using:
Git: {{git://github.com/atlassian/bamboo-git-plugin.git}}
Web Repository: None

then I can see the changeset revision in the build summary:
{noformat}
BUILD RESULT SUMMARY
Details
- Trigger    This build was manually triggered by Piotr Stefaniak
- Revisions  bamboo-git-plugin 132f5316610780fd04208d4f124a4ffbe4f4c885 <-- here
- Completed  23 Sep 2011, 9 minutes ago
- Duration   3 minutes
...etc etc
{noformat}

However if I setup some Webrepository in the repository edit configuration page, then I have empty build result summaries - like on the attached screen. No changesetId.

From what I recall this changeset key should be clickable and should redirect to the proper WebRepository page, containg that changeset. Seems to me like something is borked.
fields.summary: when you use WebRepository then revisionKey disappear from build result summaries

fields.description: Just an inline red warning, nothing more. Possibly, should warn only if the clean build task is not the first one to check out into that directory.
fields.summary: Bamboo should warn against forcing clean builds when multiple tasks checkout to the same repository.

fields.description:

This applies both to tasks and repository definitions

fields.description: The current "...to this Plan via the Plan configuration." link in the checkout task leads to job configuration, not plan configuration, which won't work.

fields.description: currently it display "This repository defines its own checkout directory". GitHub repository should work like SvnRepository or HgRepository.

fields.description:
This is the situation, my project is allocated in this folder /home/bamboo/bamboo-agent-home/xml-data/build-dir/JAVACMS-CMS-BASICTEST, but the results of my JUnit test are generated here, /home/bamboo/bamboo-agent-home/xml-data/build-dir/JAVACMS-CMS-BASICTEST/play/test-result/*.xml.
Bamboo looks like cannot specify a different folder for the test result, only the root-folder where we specify the job, but of course i cannot change that folder because i need download the source by SVN.
I'm receiving always that error.
Could not find ant Junit test results in the /home/bamboo/bamboo-agent-home/xml-data/build-dir/JAVACMS-CMS-BASICTEST directory.
fields.summary: Error finding Junit xml results

Clicking on this 'loading' tasks again usually makes it load immediately. Looks like a JS issue...

Visiting Application Links page over an mis-configured BASE_URL will load page without CSS
We should warn users when they visit Administration section over incorrect URL
fields.summary: Warn Users when BASE_URL doesn't match Request URL

fields.description:
From a Customer,
{quote}
We recently upgraded to Bamboo v3.2. People with administrative access were confused by the "User Management" option in the administrative menu. Since it's in the same spot as the "Users" option in previous Bamboo versions, they instinctively went there thinking that's where they could do things like add users to groups and other user management operations. There has just been some general confusion which I think could be resolved by:

* Renaming it to something like "User Authentication" or "User Sources"
* Moving that option somewhere else in the "Security" section.
{quote}
I agree with this point, Confluence equivalent of User Management appears at the bottom of the Security items and we should rename User Management to User Repositories
fields.summary: Rename User Management feature in Bamboo

fields.description: Bamboo can spawn unlimited threads to retrieve JIRA issue details. It is using the default cached thread pool, which has a max size that equals to {{Integer.MAX_VALUE}}. However, these threads will invoke a service ({{jiraServerManager}} that is wrapped by Spring transaction, if the issue is not cached. So the number of threads spawned by this process probably should not exceed the maximum size of the connection pool. In one support case, there were 872 threads spawned like this, all waiting to get a database connection.
fields.summary: Bamboo could spawn unlimited threads to retrieve JIRA issues

fields.description:
Currently the activity log only displays activity for the first Job and stops afterwards. The dropdown allows for selecting other Jobs, but ideally we would automatically switch to the activity of another Job when a new Stage is started. 

Alternatively we could choose to just switch to the activity of the next available running Job. But we'll have to make it clear that the activity has changed to a different Job.
fields.summary: Switch activity log to first Job in the Stage when a new Stage is started
Allign "Add Repository" button properly on Configuration screen

fields.description:
Currently the whole page refreshes and it's hard for the user to see what happens. 

Ideally the page wouldn't refresh and we would highlight the Job that was added.
fields.summary: Provide better feedback when adding a new Job via the Stage configuration

fields.description:
bamboo-capabilities.properties file on the agent server can specify capabilities that get registered with Bamboo when the agent server starts. However, the agent server still uses the agent server's environment variables to list additional capabilities on the machine and does not limit the listing of capabilities to only what it specified in the bamboo-capabilities.properties file. Perhaps create a flag in this file to enforce the limitation such as:

enforce_these_capabilities=true
fields.summary: Use new parameter in bamboo-capabilities.properties on agent server to lock agent capabilities.
Git support in Bamboo Bitbucket connector

fields.description:
Agent Server Naming - Once a new agent is started it is registered in the Bamboo Admin Agents page as myserver.mycompany.com.  On the agent server the name is stored in the file bamboo-agent.cfg such as : 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<configuration>
<buildWorkingDirectory>C:\bamboo_agents\agent01\xml-data\build-dir</buildWorkingDirectory>
<agentDefinition>
     <id>2981913</id>
      <name>myserver.mycompany.com</name>
</agentDefinition>
</configuration>

If you edit the name and change it to a custom name such as "Agent Server A", this name change is not reflected back to the agent server bamboo-agent.cfg file. 

If the Bamboo Admin intentionally or accidentally deletes the Agent in the Admin Agents page, then if the agent is restarted/re-registered with Bamboo it is listed as the name that is persisted in the bamboo-agent.cfg file (in this case myserver.mycompany.com).  

It would be more beneficial to IT admins if when you edit the agent name in the Admin Agents page to a custom value such as "My Agent Server A", that the custom value is transmitted back to the bamboo agent and persisted in the bamboo-agent.cfg file such as this : 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<configuration>
<buildWorkingDirectory>C:\bamboo_agents\agent01\xml-data\build-dir</buildWorkingDirectory>
<agentDefinition>
     <id>2981913</id>
      <name>My Agent Server A</name>
</agentDefinition>
</configuration>

This way, if the Bamboo Admin deletes the agent listing, the next time the agent is started it will be registered with the originally desired name (My Agent Server A).

Also, the agent description should be replicated back to the agent and stored in the bamboo-agent.cfg file as well. This would simplify IT maintenance of a large Bamboo installation.
fields.summary: Agent Server Name Persisted Back to Remote Agent Config File

fields.description: Add the ability for an Admin to click a link to force a status check for 1 specific remote agent or multiple agents (via checkboxes next to the agents listed in the admin agents page). This could be useful to verify if an agent has stopped responding in case someone reports a problem or you get alerted. I realize there seems to be a 10 minute timeout for an agent that is not responding, it gets marked offline. However it a heavily used environment users may report issues faster than 10 minutes and it would be nice if the bamboo admin to do a quick check from the Admin Agents dashboard.
fields.summary: Admin ability to force status check for 1 specific remote agent or all remote agents.

fields.description:
When starting a new remote agent on a windows server via command-line, assuming I pass the "installntservice" switch, it would be very helpful if it supported command-line options for specifying the windows service name and service description of the NT service. 

By default it tries to install the service name as "bamboo-remote-agent". If you try to install the same service name twice I believe it fails on the second instance.

I know you can start the agent, let it extract the bin/conf/lib directories, edit the conf/wrapper.conf manually, and then register the service using the batch files. However, having a few more command-line options like what's described above would enable more efficient creation and maintenance of starting agents, not to mention better open up the possibilities of remotely scripting the installation of multiple agents on a windows server.
fields.summary: Agent Startup - Allow Command-Line Options For NT Service Naming

fields.description:
For instance, MSTest create test result files with "&#x1F" and Bamboo reports the following exception:
{code}
2011-09-20 15:26:49,337 ERROR [pool-7-thread-1] [MSTestXmlTestResultsParser] Failed to parse xml test results. File was null.
org.dom4j.DocumentException: Error on line 671 of document : Character reference "&#x1F" is an invalid XML character. Nested exception: Character reference "&#x1F" is an invalid XML character.
at org.dom4j.io.SAXReader.read(SAXReader.java:355)
at org.dom4j.io.SAXReader.read(SAXReader.java:261)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.dotnet.tests.mstest.MSTestXmlTestResultsParser.parse(MSTestXmlTestResultsParser.java:58)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.dotnet.tests.AbstractDotNetTestReportCollector.collect(AbstractDotNetTestReportCollector.java:41)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.test.TestCollationServiceImpl$1$1.run(TestCollationServiceImpl.java:72)
at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Unknown Source)
at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(Unknown Source)
at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(Unknown Source)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
{code}
If the character is invalid, Bamboo should be able to just skip it.
fields.summary: Bamboo Test Parser does not handle invalid XML characters

fields.description: In the Bamboo Admin > Server Capabilities page, there is a link entitled "Automatically detect server capabilities" which seems to query all the agents to re-discover any capabilities using environment variables. It would be nice, and more realistic if the option is available for INDIVIDUAL servers, not all. Perhaps include the link on each View capabilities page for each Agent in the admin tool. The re-discover for all agents is nice, but in a large-scale Bamboo environment with dozens or hundreds of agents I might want to re-discover capabilities for a small number of servers, not all.
fields.summary: Automatically detect server capabilities for Individual Agent

fields.description:
due to [BSP-5470|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-5470] and [BSP-4372|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-4372]

the git plugin should recognize {{'Unknown repository format "null"; expected "0"'}} exception and gently handle it. For example it might clean the cache directory - that action is expected to fix the problem, but might be too expensive on the long run. Otherwise it might be good idea to detect and fix corrupted .git/config files - as it seems in some circumstances that file is empty, or at least it doesn't contain "{{repositoryformatversion = 0}}"




probably the issue occurs on Windows only
fields.summary: git plugin should handle a situation when cache .git/config file gets corrupted

fields.description:
Feature Suggestion....

Provide the Bamboo Admin the ability to lock or freeze the available capabilities on an agent. In the Admin Agent page, if I click Edit link next to an agent I can edit name and description. I would also like to have a checkbox that says something like "Lock Capabilities". If checked, then the capabilities cannot be changed on that agent. 

Per my understanding and testing of Bamboo 3.2, I create an agent on a remote machine. It reads environment variables to determine capabilities such as MSBuild.exe's, Ant, Maven, JDKs, etc. and then displays those as the capabilities for that Agent in the Admin Agent section.

If as an admin I delete/remove those capabilities in the Admin > Agents > View (for a specific agent) page, then if the Agent Server gets rebooted (due to power loss, maintenance, patching, etc) it makes the original capabilities available once again for Plans to use.

Use Case For Why This Feature is Needed : 

If I have 2 agents, Agent A and Agent B both running on separate OSes/Servers, I may want Agent A to be configured with Java build tools (Ant, JDK, Maven, etc). I may want Agent B configured with Microsoft build tools. Due to a variety of reasons it may be true that Agent A and Agent B both have other tools on the actual OS, but they shouldn't necessarily be shared as capabilities in the Agent.

Say a development shop does 50 Java build projects and 4 Microsoft build projects. It's true that both Agent A and Agent B could be configured to support the same capabilities, but an IT owner of Bamboo may want to ensure that the Microsoft build teams have a Bamboo Agent available and it is not constantly being utilized by the vastly larger numbers of Java teams. Thus, the Bamboo admin could strip Java-related capabilities from the Admin >Agents >View page so Plans cannot use Agent B for Java builds. However if the Agent needed to restart for above mentioned reasons then the 50 Java Plans could overtake Agent B and monopolize the Agent B. (Obviously the IT owner could strip environment variables off the server running Agent B, but the tools may actually be needed for other reasons by people directly accessing those servers, but not through Bamboo).

Based on the description the Agent itself does not need to be modified and can function as it does, however the main Bamboo server would need the "lock" feature implemented.
fields.summary: Provide Ability for Admin To Lock or Freeze Capabilities on an Agent Server
